meanings.definition: A person or thing that rouses or stirs up excitement or action.
meanings.sent1: The energetic cheerleader was a real rousers at the game.
meanings.sent2: The politician's speech was a real rousers for the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy became a little rousers during the family picnic.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected plot twist in the movie was a rousers that kept everyone on the edge of their seats.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant colors of the painting were a rousers that caught everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: Plural form of rouser, meaning a person who rouses or stirs up excitement or action.
meanings.sent1: The rousers in the crowd were cheering loudly for their team.
meanings.sent2: The group of friends were known as the rousers of the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kids turned into little rousers during the school assembly.
meanings.sent4: The music band was a rousers that got everyone dancing at the party.
meanings.sent5: The enthusiastic teacher was a rousers who inspired her students to learn.
